docs.snippet: Trade between the United States and Brazil reached a new high of approximately $1,800,000,000 in 1951, but it may fall off considerably this year, Dr. Jose G. Torres, retiring director of the Brazilian Government Trade Bureau here, said last week.
docs.lead_paragraph: Trade between the United States and Brazil reached a new high of approximately $1,800,000,000 in 1951, but it may fall off considerably this year, Dr. Jose G. Torres, retiring director of the Brazilian Government Trade Bureau here, said last week.
docs.abstract: Dr Torres sees trade dip; succeeded by L Costa as US bur dir

headline.main: BRAZIL-U. S. TRADE IS SEEN DECLINING; But Crisis Caused Peak in '51, Says Dr. Torres, and a Drop Is Only Natural

docs.snippet: TRAVEL in the Americas outside the continental limits of the United States entails border crossings, which means the traveler must prepare himself before leaving home with documents necessary to get him into some countries and to let him return to...
docs.lead_paragraph: TRAVEL in the Americas outside the continental limits of the United States entails border crossings, which means the traveler must prepare himself before leaving home with documents necessary to get him into some countries and to let him return to his own country.

headline.main: TRAVELING PAPERS; Variety of Documents Is Required of Tourists

docs.snippet: SOUTH AMERICA means ten republics, of which one alone -- Brazil -- is larger than the United States. It is a vast continent of contrasts, offering anything the visitor may be seeking. But since it is around 2,200 miles to the nearest capital in South...
docs.lead_paragraph: SOUTH AMERICA means ten republics, of which one alone -- Brazil -- is larger than the United States. It is a vast continent of contrasts, offering anything the visitor may be seeking. But since it is around 2,200 miles to the nearest capital in South America, and nearly 6,000 to the farthest, it is a good idea for the tourist to be fairly specific in his travel plans before he leaves home.

headline.main: IMPROVEMENTS ON THE SOUTH AMERICAN CIRCUIT

docs.snippet: PETROPOLIS, Brazil, April 17 --Brazil is preparing "revolutionary" legislation to improve conditions of farm workers, President Getulio Vargas declared here today in a speech opening the fifth regional conference of American states who are members of...
docs.lead_paragraph: PETROPOLIS, Brazil, April 17 --Brazil is preparing "revolutionary" legislation to improve conditions of farm workers, President Getulio Vargas declared here today in a speech opening the fifth regional conference of American states who are members of the International Labor Office.
docs.abstract: conf opens; Min Viana made pres; Pres Vargas (Brazil) and P Ramadier s; Dir Gen Morse unable to attend

docs.snippet: Members of the American Newspaper Publishers Association will vote today on a resolution attacking President Truman's seizure of the steel industry and his statement implying he had similar power to seize the press. According to the proposed...
docs.lead_paragraph: Members of the American Newspaper Publishers Association will vote today on a resolution attacking President Truman's seizure of the steel industry and his statement implying he had similar power to seize the press. According to the proposed resolution, no such power over the press exists, and any effort to seize the press will be resisted and defeated.
